DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Platinum Refractory Present Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A metal that is an important component of some anticancer drugs, such as cisplatin and carboplatin._In medicine, describes a disease or condition that does not respond to treatment._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._the yes/no indicator related to the evaluation of the patient and patient's disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A metal that is an important component of some anticancer drugs, such as cisplatin and carboplatin.:Refractory; not responding to treatment.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Pt, atomic number 78, and atomic weight 195.09.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have platinu
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have platinum-refractory disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient considered to be platinum-resistant or refractory according to standard GOG criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have recurrent platinum-resistant or refractory disease (defined as disease that has progressed while receiving platinum or had recurrence within 6 months of the last receipt of platinum based chemotherapy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have high grade, recurrent, platinum resistant ovarian cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have recurrent/persistent platinum-resistant epithelial ovarian, primary peritoneal, or fallopian tube cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have recurrent/persistent platinum-resistant ovarian, primary peritoneal, or fallopian tube cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have platinum-resistant disease, defined as progression within less than 6 months from completion of platinum-based therapy, and inclusive of platinum refractory disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have primary platinum refractory disease?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-2 2018320v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw Changed from CTEP to GOG for REBOYJ by script Thu Aug 1 14:45:44 EDT 2013
